identificationModule.briefTitle: Pilot Trial of Abdominal Core Rehabilitation To Improve Outcomes After Ventral Hernia Repair
identificationModule.officialTitle: Pilot Trial of Abdominal Core Rehabilitation To Improve Outcomes After Ventral Hernia Repair

collaborators.name: National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK)

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study aims to evaluate the potential role of physical therapy in improving outcomes after ventral hernia repair.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: After being informed about the study and potential risks, all patients giving written informed consent will perform assessments of several activities of daily living and complete several surveys detailing their pre-surgical abilities, quality of life, and pain. Immediately after their surgical procedure, patients will be randomized in a single-blind manner (investigator) in a 1:1 ratio to supervised physical therapy (8 weeks, twice weekly) or standard post-surgical precautions. Assessments and surveys will be repeated by the blinded investigator at 30 days, 10 weeks, 6 months, and 1 year after surgery.

armGroups.label: Standard Post-operative Instructions
armGroups.description: Participants in the control group will be told upon post-operative discharge that they should follow the post-operative instructions.

armGroups.label: Supervised Physical Therapy
armGroups.description: Participants in the physical therapy group will be scheduled for visits to the physical therapy clinic beginning two weeks after surgery, and will undergo supervised physical therapy treatments approximately twice per week for eight weeks according to a standardized evidence-based post-operative abdominal core surgery rehabilitation program.

interventions.name: Supervised Physical Therapy
interventions.description: The twice-per-week 8-week course of supervised physical therapy begins 2 weeks after surgery. It targets abdominal core function through progressive muscle retraining and strengthening, and patient-specific posture and body mechanics education.

interventions.name: Post-operative Precautions
interventions.description: This intervention includes standard of care post-operative instructions typically given to patients undergoing ventral hernia repair across the world. These include limiting strenuous physical activity and a lifting restriction of no more than 10 pounds for 6 weeks. Binder use is also encouraged for 4-6 weeks after the operation.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline in Five times sit-to-stand time
primaryOutcomes.description: From a standard chair, stand and sit back down five times in immediate succession as quickly as possible.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline before surgery, 10 weeks after surgery

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline in Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) - Physical Function
primaryOutcomes.description: Computer-adaptive patient-reported questionnaire asking questions about physical function.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline before surgery, 10 weeks after surgery

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline in Quiet unstable sitting test
primaryOutcomes.description: Sit on an inflated cushion that creates an unstable surface for 60 seconds with eyes closed and arms crossed while counting to a metronome.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline before surgery, 10 weeks after surgery

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Hernia related quality of life survey from baseline
secondaryOutcomes.description: Patient-reported questionnaire asking questions about abdominal wall function including activities of daily living, independent mobility, and mental health.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline before surgery, 10 weeks after surgery

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Timed Up-And-Go time from baseline
secondaryOutcomes.description: Starting seated in a standard chair, stand, walk forward 3 m, turn 180 deg, walk back to chair, sit down. Do all of these as quickly as can be done safely.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline before surgery, 10 weeks after surgery

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from baseline in International Physical Activity Questionnaire - Short Form
secondaryOutcomes.description: Self-reported physical activity questions spanning sedentary behavior, job activity, transportation activity, household activity, and recreational activity.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline before surgery, 10 weeks after surgery

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from baseline in Tampa Scale of Kinesiophobia - Short Form
secondaryOutcomes.description: Self-reported questions on how fear affects desire and ability to perform physical activities.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline before surgery, 10 weeks after surgery

secondaryOutcomes.description: Patient-reported questionnaire asking questions regarding a recurrence of the hernia based on pain and presence of a physical bulge.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Hernia related quality of life survey from baseline
secondaryOutcomes.description: Patient-reported questionnaire asking questions about abdominal wall function including activities of daily living, independent mobility, and mental health.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline before surgery, 1 year after surgery

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Timed Up-And-Go time from baseline
secondaryOutcomes.description: Starting seated in a standard chair, stand, walk forward 3 m, turn 180 deg, walk back to chair, sit down. Do all of these as quickly as can be done safely.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria

* Ages 18+
* Diagnosis of ventral hernia
* Scheduled for elective ventral hernia repair
* Independent functional status
* Transverse hernia width of 2cm or greater

Exclusion Criteria

* Previously diagnosed movement or balance disorder
* Use of ambulatory assistive device (walker or cane)
* Not currently undergoing or planning to undergo physical therapy or other skilled exercise intervention supervised by a medical rehabilitation professional

locations.facility: Ohio State University Wexner Medical Center

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: Only de-identified data will be shared with other researchers.
